Aesthetics options Commonly used characteristics of plotting characters that can be **mapped to a specific variable** in the data are - `colour` - `shape` - `size` - `alpha` (transparency) --- ## Colour .pull-left[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm, colour = species)) + #<< geom_point() + scale_colour_viridis_d() ``` ::: ] .pull-right[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){fig-align='center' width=100%} ::: ::: ] --- ## Alpha .pull-left[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm, colour = species, shape = species, size = body_mass_g, alpha = flipper_length_mm)) + #<< geom_point() + scale_colour_viridis_d() ``` ::: ] .pull-right[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){fig-align='center' width=100%} ::: ::: ] --- .pull-left[ **Mapping** ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm, size = body_mass_g, #<< alpha = flipper_length_mm)) + #<< geom_point() ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){fig-align='center' width=100%} ::: ::: ] .pull-right[ **Setting** ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm)) + geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.5) #<< ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-25-1.png){fig-align='center' width=100%} ::: ::: ] --- ## Mapping vs. setting - **Mapping:** Determine the size, alpha, etc. of points based on the values of a variable in the data - goes into `aes()` - **Setting:** Determine the size, alpha, etc. of points **not** based on the values of a variable in the data - goes into `geom_*()` (this was `geom_point()` in the previous example, but we'll learn about other geoms soon!) --- class: middle # Faceting --- ## Faceting - Smaller plots that display different subsets of the data - Useful for exploring conditional relationships and large data --- .panelset[ .panel[.panel-name[Plot] ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-26-1.png){fig-align='center' width=70%} ::: ::: ] .panel[.panel-name[Code] ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm)) + geom_point() + facet_grid(species ~ island) #<< ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values (geom_point). ``` ::: ::: ] ] --- ## But you should always label your plots! ] --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm)) + geom_point() + facet_grid(species ~ sex) #<< ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-27-1.png){fig-align='center' width=60%} ::: ::: --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm)) + geom_point() + facet_grid(sex ~ species) #<< ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-28-1.png){fig-align='center' width=60%} ::: ::: --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm)) + geom_point() + facet_wrap(~ species) #<< ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-29-1.png){fig-align='center' width=60%} ::: ::: --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm)) + geom_point() + facet_grid(. ~ species) #<< ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-30-1.png){fig-align='center' width=60%} ::: ::: --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_depth_mm, y = bill_length_mm)) + geom_point() + facet_wrap(~ species, ncol = 2) #<< ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u2-d02-ggplot2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-31-1.png){fig-align='center' width=60%} ::: ::: --- ## Faceting summary -
